name: 2-phenylhydroquinone
Reason: 2-phenylhydroquinone has a melting point that we can compare to benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C. The introduction of the phenyl group increases the melting point due to the enhancement of π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. Each phenyl group may contribute around +30 to +50°C. Additionally, the hydroquinone moiety introduces two phenolic hydroxyl groups, which can participate in hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by approximately +20°C.
